description: David and Kevin Estrem, brothers who grew up on their family’s dairy farm in Minnesota, now grow corn and soybeans there, managing 5,400 acres over 45 farms. The Estrem family meets at “Grandpa and...
full_description: David and Kevin Estrem, brothers who grew up on their family’s dairy farm in Minnesota, now grow corn and soybeans there, managing 5,400 acres over 45 farms. The Estrem family meets at “Grandpa and Grandma’s house” over their traditional morning coffee every day to discuss their game plan, and then they turn to modern Microsoft and Land O’Lakes technology for efficiencies that help get more bushels out of every acre. “My dad would be very, very proud,” David Estrem says.
title: Estrem family farm embraces Microsoft technology with Land O’Lakes to make dad proud

description: As a parent of a newborn with rare disease, monitoring for subtle health changes is critical, if not lifesaving. See how Microsoft technology brings to life the vision of Dr. Girish Shirali, creati...
full_description: As a parent of a newborn with rare disease, monitoring for subtle health changes is critical, if not lifesaving. See how Microsoft technology brings to life the vision of Dr. Girish Shirali, creating a system where nurses and doctors can be brought home, virtually, even from hundreds of miles away.
title: Children’s Mercy app brings doctors home, virtually, with babies born with heart disease

description: Microsoft employees came together across continents, time zones, and cultures to address the refugee crisis through Microsoft cloud intelligence. Learn how their Family Finder mobile app could help...
full_description: Microsoft employees came together across continents, time zones, and cultures to address the refugee crisis through Microsoft cloud intelligence. Learn how their Family Finder mobile app could help refugees locate missing loved ones and offer better technical solutions for humanitarian and relief organizations.
title: Microsoft Hackathon Project: Reuniting refugees with loved ones

description: What if you could teach your brain to respond differently? Inspired by their leader and fellow employee who lives with a neurological disorder, this Microsoft Hackathon team aims to use augmented r...
full_description: What if you could teach your brain to respond differently? Inspired by their leader and fellow employee who lives with a neurological disorder, this Microsoft Hackathon team aims to use augmented reality to help the brain establish new learned connections and stop misfiring.
title: Retrain the brain with HoloLens

title: The 50 Peaks Challenge Episode 1

full_description: As Melissa and Maddie continue on the 50 Peaks Challenge, logistics prove to be more challenging than the actual climbs. The team rallies to problem-solve in real time with the help of Christine on the ground and Microsoft technology keeping them connected at every step.
title: The 50 Peaks Challenge Episode 3: Logistical obstacles

description: When Ziad Sankari was 17 years old, his father died of a heart attack. That tragedy, which could have been avoided if there had been a way to monitor his heart, inspired Sankari to found a pioneeri...
full_description: When Ziad Sankari was 17 years old, his father died of a heart attack. That tragedy, which could have been avoided if there had been a way to monitor his heart, inspired Sankari to found a pioneering medical technology company, CardioDiagnostics, that specializes in developing cardiac monitoring products and services for doctors and patients. When the group came across Microsoft Azure technologies, “it literally transformed our ability to create scalable, available and durable products.”
title: With mobile monitoring, cardiac patients are a heartbeat away from help

description: Duffy always loved big, loud, fast machines. Growing up in Arizona, he worked in hot rod shops, hung out at car shows and drove a thunderous Chevy. After working in the snowboard industry and then ...
full_description: Duffy always loved big, loud, fast machines. Growing up in Arizona, he worked in hot rod shops, hung out at car shows and drove a thunderous Chevy. After working in the snowboard industry and then going back to design school, Duffy founded Seattle design studio, Electric Coffin, and established himself as a leading artist in the Pacific Northwest.
title: Patrick ‘Duffy’ De Armas: Turning fast cars into fine art

description: At this year’s Moogfest, we caught up with the future thought leaders to discuss the music and technology landscape. As part of the conversation Amos Gaynes (Moog Music Product Specialist), Onyx As...
full_description: At this year’s Moogfest, we caught up with the future thought leaders to discuss the music and technology landscape. As part of the conversation Amos Gaynes (Moog Music Product Specialist), Onyx Ashanti (Sonocybernetic Patternist), EMA (Musician and Multimedia Artist), and Josette Melchor (Gray Area Founder) discussed Moogfest, the music & tech community, and how projects like Realiti – Inside the Music of Grimes are pushing the boundaries of the music experience.
title: Realiti – Inside the Music of Grimes

description: Alex Eaton started Sistema Biobolsa in 2010, amidst a struggling economy, Mexico’s drug war and the swine flu epidemic. After sleeping on farmers’ floors across Mexico for years to get his company ...
full_description: Alex Eaton started Sistema Biobolsa in 2010, amidst a struggling economy, Mexico’s drug war and the swine flu epidemic. After sleeping on farmers’ floors across Mexico for years to get his company off the ground, today he’s helping agricultural families around the world. His team built a system that transforms animal manure into usable fuel and organic fertilizer. To spread his idea globally, he uses Skype, Windows10 and Office 365 to run an ever-evolving business.
title: Bio-digester technology improves farming in Mexico, and beyond

description: Andre Hueston Mack has always been an underdog. A former businessman turned award-winning sommelier, he spent years carving an unconventional path. Then he left the restaurant world to make his own...
full_description: Andre Hueston Mack has always been an underdog. A former businessman turned award-winning sommelier, he spent years carving an unconventional path. Then he left the restaurant world to make his own wines—his way. Now a nationwide distributor of 33,000 cases each year, he’s surprised an entire industry and had fun while doing it.
title: Sommelier and ‘black sheep’ takes the outsider’s approach to winemaking
